definition: to force a smile/a bitter laugh

sentences.english: As he crumples the flowering end of the weed in his hand, Nelson grimaces.
sentences.chinese: 尼爾森苦笑着掐斷手中雜草的花，把雜草弄死。

sentences.english: He summoned up a sickly smile for camera .
sentences.chinese: 他強打精神對攝像機苦笑一下。

sentences.english: "We don't need the money, " says Musk with a wry smile.
sentences.chinese: “我們不需要這個錢，”馬思科苦笑了一下說。

sentences.english: No answer from Mrs. ----, just a wistful half-smile.
sentences.chinese: 該女士實在無話可說，只好苦笑。

sentences.english: Father smiled and waved his hand, eyes showing imperceptible sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸苦笑着擺了擺手，眼睛裏流露出不易覺察的悲傷。

sentences.english: Only when someone shouted "Don't smile, then!" did they break into grins.
sentences.chinese: 只有當別人說“別笑了”，他們才苦笑一會兒。

sentences.english: He sat back on the bed with a bitter laugh, and finished taking off his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他苦笑了一下，坐回牀上，總算脫下了鞋。

sentences.english: "Plus a million supporters, " he adds, with a mirthless laugh.
sentences.chinese: 支持者，”他苦笑着補充一句。

sentences.english: Han Xiaoou smiled bitterly, she knew Deng Biao do is let her finish the task.
sentences.chinese: 韓曉鷗滿臉苦笑，她明白鄧彪這麼做是讓她完成任務。

sentences.english: When your child starts to sneeze and sniffle, you don't have to feel helpless.
sentences.chinese: 當你的孩子開始打噴嚏和苦笑了，你沒有感到無助。

sentences.english: Theres nothing we can do about it, so well just have to grin and bear it.
sentences.chinese: 我們對此無能爲力，因此只好苦笑着忍了下來。

sentences.english: Jean Valjean directed upon her that heartrending smile to which he occasionally had recourse
sentences.chinese: 冉阿讓向她苦笑，有時他就這樣笑着。

sentences.english: answered the clergyman, with a bitter smile.
"Well, they know it now, " Hamblen said, smiling.
sentences.chinese: “不，他們現在肯定意識到了，”弗蘭克苦笑道。

sentences.english: "We could always try coffee," she says wryly.
sentences.chinese: “那就試試咖啡”，昂山素季苦笑着說。

definition: to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to have heard what was said
